headline: Marjorie Taylor Greene backs Robby Starbuck, Ortagus not worthy of Trump support
author: Paul Bedard
sentences: Awkward as it may appear because Trump and Greene are very close, she told Secrets that Ortagus was not worthy of the former presidents support because she had offered support for the incoming Biden administration on social media, though she has been sharply critical of the presidents recent policies.

Conservative firebrand Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene endorsed two more House candidates today, including social media influencer and Tennessee House candidate Robby Starbuck, who just yesterday saw former President Donald Trump back a likely challenger and former aide, Morgan Ortagus.

What I bring to the table is I say exactly what everyday America says when they're in their home, when they're at Bible study, when they're at work, or they're on lunch break, when they're hanging out with their friends throwing back a couple of beers, she told me.

In making endorsements, the first-term Georgia lawmaker told Secrets that she is hoping to build a sizable "America first" coalition in the House and Senate that is ready to challenge weak leaders and the swamp.

So far, she has backed Starbuck, Collins, Vance, Georgia Senate candidate Herschel Walker, Illinois Rep. Mary Miller, North Carolina House candidate Bo Hines, and Florida House candidate Anthony Sabatini.
I don't think he was informed enough about this woman that he put out, like, a soft endorsement for her, said Greene, who hopes to discuss the race with Trump on Friday.
Her endorsement of Starbuck came the day after Trump urged Ortagus, his State Department spokeswoman, to enter the race in Tennessee's 5th Congressional District.
I just say the truth in Washington, and it's the truth that everybody there just gets so offended by, but it's actually what real America believes, Greene added.
Vance, cheering his promise to vote against keeping Sen. Mitch McConnell as the GOP leader in the chamber if he wins.
Trump's support for Ortagus has drawn sharp criticism from his base, even former advisers.
He has been a champion for America first for a long time, Greene told Secrets of Starbuck.
Greene has so far endorsed seven candidates running for House and Senate seats.
She also endorsed Texas candidate Christian Collins, a youth organizer.

And he's in it for all the right reasons, she said.
He's just a really good guy.
